snippet: Restaurants are betting that consumers accustomed to paying extra for holiday-weekend flights or V.I.P. seats at the theater will also pay more for a Saturday night dinner at 8.
abstract: Every restaurant faces the challenge of elasticity of demand in an industry where overhead costs are the same whether there is a single diner or a full house; some have begun borrowing a tactic from other hospitality businesses--variable pricing--and charging different prices for meals at different times; tools of variable pricing range from Groupon to mobile apps and Web sites offering discounted meals based on reservation time.
lead_paragraph: Restaurants are betting that consumers accustomed to paying extra for holiday-weekend flights or V.I.P. seats at the theater will also pay more for a Saturday night dinner at 8.

headline.seo: Restaurant Prices Can Vary by Reservation Time
headline.main: When It Comes to Reservations, Time Is Money
headline.print_headline: When It Comes to Reservations, Time Is Money
